item.content:encoded:
In this article, I will explain how to change the banking details for your SASSA (South African Social Security Agency) grant. Previously I did this because I wanted to switch from FNB Bank to Capitec Bank to receive my R370 SASSA grant payments. I was worried that the grant money might delayed during the change.

However, the process ended up being much easier than I thought it would be. I learned some helpful things along the way, and now I want to share my experience to make it a smooth process for you too.

Whether you have changed banks recently, made a mistake on your initial SASSA grant application, or simply want to update your details, I will walk you through all the steps needed to change your SASSA grant banking details

.

There are important things to remember:

You can only change your banking details to a bank account in your name. SASSA will not send money to someone else’s account.

Only request a change if your bank account details are different now, or if you made a mistake when you entered them originally.

Have your South African ID number and the cell phone number you used when you applied for the grant ready. You will need these to make the change.

How To Change Banking Details for the SASSA R370 Grant

  1. First, Visit the Official SASSA Website:
    • Visit srd.sassa.gov.za – this is the official website for SASSA.
  2. Find the Section Called “How do I change my banking details”:
    • Scroll down the website until you see a section called “How do I change my bank details?”
  3. Type in Your ID Number:
    • Carefully enter your South African ID number in the box provided. Then click “Submit”.
  4. Wait for a Confirmation SMS:
    • SASSA will send a special text message (SMS) to the cell phone number you used when you first applied for the grant. This may take a few minutes.
  5. Open the Link in the SMS: Once you receive the text message,
    • click on the link. This link is unique to you and can only be used once for safety.
  6. Follow the Steps: The link will take you to a page with simple instructions. Read each step slowly and carefully, then enter:
  • The name of your new bank and your username.
  • The type of account you are using (savings, checking, etc.).
  • Your new account number (double-check it is correct!).
  1. Submit and Wait: After entering all your new bank details correctly, click “Submit”. You may receive another text message or a website message confirming the change.

That’s it! SASSA will verify your updated information. If your information is correct, then the future grant payments will be deposited into your new bank account.

How to update banking details on SASSA?

1.Visit srd.sassa.gov.za.
2. Navigate to “How do I change my bank details?”
3. Enter your ID number and submit.
4. Wait for a confirmation SMS.
5. Open the link and follow instructions.
6. Enter new bank details.
7. Submit and wait for confirmation.

How to change contact details on SASSA?

The best way to change contact details with SASSA is to call them so that an agent can update your previous number to the new one.

item.content:encoded:
To help people who are struggling financially, the South African government provides different grants or money assistance.

However, many people who receive these grants are confused about how to apply, who qualifies, and how they get paid.

In this article, I’ll share my personal experience specifically with how grant money is paid out. I’ll also explain how to change the payment method for the SASSA R370 grant if you need to. Let’s get started!

How to Change SASSA R370 Payment Method

To Change SASSA R370 Payment Method Here are the steps should take:

  • first, visit the official SASSA website: srd.sassa.gov.za
  • scroll down to the section that says “How do I change my banking Details?”
  • click on the link that says “Apply for changes and change the payment method for SASSA R350 grant from post office to online bank account”
  • A form will open up where you will enter your new bank account information and after that click on submit

When I first applied for the SASSA grant, I registered using my cell phone number. So when I changed my payment details, SASSA sent me a message about it on my phone.

Overall, my experience with SASSA has been good so far. I get my grant payment on time without any problems now. If you are still going to the post office and shops to get your SASSA R370 grant, I really encourage you to change your payment method to direct bank deposit instead.

How long does it take for SASSA to verify banking details

SASSA typically completes the verification of your bank account details within seven working days. During this time, SASSA diligently processes and verifies the provided bank details, ensuring all necessary formal procedures are accurately completed.

How to check SASSA R370 payment dates for 2024

To check your SASSA R370 payment date for 2024, visit https://350statuscheck.org.za/.

Why is my SASSA R370 is approved but no payment?

If your SASSA R370 is approved but no payment has been received, wait for SASSA to provide your payment. SASSA will issue your payment on the day indicated on your status SASSA R370 STATUS.

How Can I Collect My SASSA Money on Payment Date?

SASSA has announced when people will get their Sassa payment for May 2024. They’ll start payment people at 03 may 2024 for Old Age Grant.

Disability Grant Payment Date for May 2024

People who receive the Disability Grant will get their money on Monday, May 6th, 2024. If you get any other grants along with your disability grant, you’ll receive them at the same time.

Children Grant Payment Date for May 2024

Parents who receive money for their Child Grant will receive their Child Grant payment on Tuesday, May 7th, 2024.

You can receive your money from this pay points or stores partnered with SASSA, such as Shoprite, Boxer, or Pick n Pay. Just make sure to visit the pay point on your payment date.
